column3: Description

column5: Phase name followed by an integer as a code to represent VS station name

column4: Epicentral distance between event and VS grid center in degrees

column3: Number of records that is used to stack for virtual stations
VS location longitude in degrees
Earthquake hypocentral location latitude in degreesb
Earthquake hypocentral location longitude in degreesb

column4: Earthquake hypocentral location depth in kmb

column3: Earthquake moment magnitudeb

column5: Azimuth from earthquake to VS grid (in degrees)

column3: Back azimuth measured at VS clockwise back to earthquake (in degrees)

column4: Either S, Sdiff, SS, SSm, S3, S3m, S4, S4m, S5, S5m, S6m, ScS, ScS2, ScS3, ScS3m, ScS4, ScS4m, ScS5, or ScS5m

column3: Travel time prediction of the PREM model
Travel time anomaly of phase onset relative to PREM (observed minus PREM)
Travel time anomaly of phase onset relative to PREM (observed minus PREM) corrected for over-broadened virtual station stack

The start time, relative to PREM prediction, of the beginning of the time window used to define one pulse width of VS phase of interest on velocity recordings, measured at the 10% amplitude level preceding the wave peak (used to auto-define the Misfit measurement windows)

The end time, relative to the PREM prediction, of the end of the time window used to define one pulse width of VS phase of interest on velocity recordings, measured at the 10% amplitude level following the wave peak (used to auto-define the Misfit measurement windows)

column5: VS SNR measurement from the average amplitude of the signal to the average amplitude of the noise

column3: SNR of all records used to create a VS stack
VS SNR measurement from the maximum peak-to-trough value within one period of the signal compared to noise
The average difference between the VS phase and the best-fit SEW over one period (as in Equation 2)

column4: As above, except over one period preceding the phase of interest
As above, except over one period following the phase of interest

column6: The best-fit t* value that, when convolved with the SEW, gives the best-fit to records that are broader than the SEW

column3: A measure of the amount the SEW has to be narrowed to fit records that are narrower than the SEW
Cross-correlation coefficient between observed record and the best-fitting SEW adapted to the record
Cross-correlation coefficient between observed record and the GEW, which measures the record’s fit to the average S wave phase shape for the event
Gaussian factor of the best-fitting Gaussian function (g, Equation 1) to a record’s best-fitting SEW
Gaussian factor of the best-fitting Gaussian function (g, Equation 1) to the GEW for the event
The misfit measured between g_best-fit_SEW and g_event_SEW (computed as in Equation 2) which provides a different measure of record broadening
An empirical comprehensive weight value for each data (see Equation 3)
Records that have “traffic” (interfering seismic waves) predicted to arrive in the noise window (of the SNR measurement) are flagged as 1, otherwise 0
Estimated period of the phase, from the start and end of the pulse measured at 0.1 amplitude (when peak is set to 1) measured on displacement recordings
The predicted amplitude between [-1,1] using the SH radiation pattern for the phase of interest
